alert.note: Alert for Ware (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 3:49AM EDT until April 09 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and southeast Georgia, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Baker, Duval and Nassau. In southeast Georgia, Camden, Charlton and Ware. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, St. Marys, Kingsland, Fernandina Beach, Hilliard, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Kings Bay Base, Taylor, Yulee, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Nassau Village-Ratliff, Ratliff, Kings Ferry, Cisco Gardens, Oceanway, St. George, Bryceville and Little Talbot Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
